value.title: Handle errors in Rust
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn about ways to handle errors in Rust.

value.title: Save money with Azure Reserved Instances
value.excerpt: Learn how to use plan for, buy, and manage Azure reservations to save money.

value.title: Introduction to securing data at rest on Azure
value.excerpt: Identify the data in your organization and store it on Azure. Store secrets securely, and use client-side encryption and Storage Service Encryption to help protect your data.

value.title: Stage a web app deployment for testing and rollback by using App Service deployment slots
value.excerpt: Discover the benefits of creating deployment slots to streamline deployment and roll back a web app in Azure App Service.

value.title: Store and access graph data in Azure Cosmos DB with the Graph API
value.excerpt: Find out about creating an application with Azure Cosmos DB as a graph database, then retrieve, manipulate, and visualize graph data using Data Explorer.

value.title: Store and Access NoSQL Data with Azure Cosmos DB and the Table API
value.excerpt: By using the Azure Cosmos DB Table API, you will benefit from the low latency, high availability, and scalability of Azure Cosmos DB in a Table storage application.

value.title: Approach your data-flow diagram with the right threat model focus
value.excerpt: Threat modeling is an effective technique to help you identify threats and ways to reduce or eliminate risk. We start by deciding to focus on either what needs to be protected or who it needs protection from.

value.title: Prioritize your issues and apply security controls
value.excerpt: Threat modeling provides you with a list of threats and ways to reduce or eliminate risk, but it doesn't prioritize them for you. Also, there are no layered security control recommendations based on their type and function.

value.title: Use a framework to identify threats and find ways to reduce or eliminate risk
value.excerpt: Threat modeling helps you generate a list of potential threats using STRIDE and find ways to reduce or eliminate risk with corresponding security controls.

value.title: Use recommended tools to create a data-flow diagram
value.excerpt: You can use any canvas, physical or virtual, to create a data-flow diagram. Engineers at Microsoft recommend three tools to help you in your threat modeling journey.

value.title: Troubleshoot data governance
value.excerpt: Troubleshoot data governance

value.title: Troubleshoot inbound network connectivity for Azure Load Balancer
value.excerpt: Learn how to troubleshoot inbound network connectivity for Azure Load Balancer.

value.title: Declare variable types in TypeScript
value.excerpt: Learn about the available types and how to associate them with variables.

value.title: Introduction to Windows Virtual Desktop in Microsoft Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to use Windows Virtual Desktop to deliver remote desktop and remote app experiences in Microsoft Azure.

value.title: Azure Automation | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Jenny Hunter joins Scott Hanselman to discuss Azure Automation, which has seen several new improvements including support for Python 2, the ability to run against local Linux machines, the ability to run against any Azure VM with no setup (Run Command), and native Azure alert integration. [03:27] Demo
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/DgMJC9bWWrE" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Azure Friday | Apache Kafka on HDInsight
value.excerpt: Raghav Mohan joins Scott Hanselman to talk about Apache Kafka on HDInsight, which added the open-source distributed streaming platform last year to complete a scalable, big data streaming scenario on Azure. The service has come a long way since - processing millions of events/sec, petabytes of data/day
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/gttwnNDHuZ4" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Azure Friday | Azure App Service with Hybrid Connections to On-premises Resources
value.excerpt: Christina Compy joins Scott Hanselman to talk about the recently relaunched App Service Hybrid Connections. This feature enables your apps in the App Service to reach resources on other networks. Those other networks can be in Azure, on-premises or networks in other cloud providers.   Azure App Service
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/y_zAJZC_8Yk" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Azure Friday | Azure Availability Zones
value.excerpt: Raj Ganapathy joins Scott Hanselman to discuss the new addition to Azure's resiliency offerings – Availability Zones. Azure Availability Zones are fault-isolated locations within an Azure region to help protect customers applications and data from datacenter-level failures with independent power, network,
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/PP02QxplC2E" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Azure Friday | Azure Backup
value.excerpt: Even though Azure takes three copies of your virtual machines and stores them in Azure Storage, you still need to protect your data against ransomware, corruption, or accidental deletion. Kelly Anderson stops by to chat with Scott Hanselman about how simple it is to set up Azure Backup, how its built-in
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/HJeCqbbT-5s" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Azure Friday | Azure CDN: Dynamic Site Acceleration
value.excerpt: Richard Li joins Scott Hanselman to discuss the new Dynamic Site Acceleration (DSA) optimization for Azure CDN, and how it can be used in combination with standard CDN caching features to measurably improve the performance of web pages with dynamic content.   For more information, see:  Dynamic Site

value.title: Azure Friday | Azure IoT Hub
value.excerpt: Olivier Bloch joins Scott Hanselman to discuss Azure IoT and how it is more than just about connecting IoT devices and sending telemetry to the Cloud. They also talk about Azure IoT device topics such as twins, provisioning, and lifecycle management.  For more information, see:  Azure IoT Hub - http://aka.ms/azureiotgetstarted

value.title: Azure Security Center | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Kelly Anderson joins Scott Hanselman to discuss Azure Security Center, which offers built-in security management and threat protection for your cloud workloads. Azure Security Center helps you find & fix vulnerabilities, aids in blocking malicious access and alerts you when your resources are under attack.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/t6gp9k78XEw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Cloud Security Posture Management (CSPM) with Azure Security Center | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Azure Security Center enables you to strengthen your security posture. Yuri Diogenes joins Scott Hanselman to show how Security Center helps you identify and perform the hardening tasks recommended as security best practices and implement them across your machines, data services, and apps.  0:00 - Intro

value.title: Continuous integration and deployment using Azure Data Factory | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Gaurav Malhotra joins Scott Hanselman to discuss how you can follow industry-leading best practices to do continuous integration and deployment for your Extract Transform/Load (ETL) and Extract Load/Transform (ELT) workflows to multiple environments such as Dev, Test, Prod, and more.  For more information:

value.title: Create dependent pipelines in your Azure Data Factory | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Data integration is complex and has many moving parts that spans across hybrid data environments. Typically, data integration projects have dependencies upstream and downstream making dependencies an important aspect to consider in any job scheduling. value.title: Deploy your Web App in Windows Containers on Azure App Service | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Windows Container support is available in preview in Azure App Service. By deploying applications via Windows Containers in Azure App Service you can install your dependencies inside the container, call APIs currently blocked by the Azure App Service sandbox and use the power of containers to migrate
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Fe_AYBD5m0I" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Durable functions in Python for Azure Functions | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: David Justo joins Scott Hanselman to discuss durable functions in Python, which is an extension of Azure Functions for writing stateful functions in a serverless compute environment. The extension is already available for C# and JavaScript and is now available for Python.  0:00 – Introduction 1:38 –

value.title: Getting started with Azure Static Web Apps | Azure Tips and Tricks
value.excerpt: In this video, you'll learn how to get started with Azure Static Web Apps.   For more tips and tricks, visit: https://aka.ms/azuretipsandtricks   Get started with 12 months of free services and $200 USD in credit. Create your free account today with Microsoft Azure: https://azure.com/free   Azure Documentation

value.title: Go serverless: Real-time applications with Azure SignalR Service | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Modern applications light up with real-time information. Anthony Chu joins Donovan Brown to show how to deliver live updates from Azure Functions to web, mobile, and desktop apps with Azure SignalR Service. Learn how to send real-time messages over WebSockets from your serverless apps with a few lines
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/FmxAf8TfFkc" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: How to access GRUB on Ubuntu | Azure Tips and Tricks
value.excerpt: In this edition of Azure Tips and Tricks, Alfred from the Azure Serial Console team will show you how to enable GRUB on your Ubuntu virtual machine. You will also learn how to use GRUB to enter single user mode.   For more tips and tricks, visit: http://azuredev.tips   Get started with 12 months of free
